sentences.sentence: Sign in Join now View public profile Sign in to follow 6,318 Followers 172 0 1mo · Edited Report this post Fears of the #telecom #network #congestion seem to be getting real - " #EU has called on streaming services such as Netflix and YouTube to limit their services in order to prevent the continent's #broadband networks from crashing as tens of millions of people start working from home".
A heretic thought - what about some old fashioned traffic shaping.
But extraordinary times might require extraordinary measures.

When Comcast was caught targeting BitTorrent traffic, their eventual response was exactly right: address congestion when and where it happens by throttling back the heaviest users, no matter what application they are using.
If there's an argument now that consumer video has to take a back seat during business hours because of video-conferencing for school and work, let's hear it.
But let's NOT hear that networks will turn around and try to charge extra for that kind of prioritization.

I testified in Congress on exactly this topic in 2018, and noted there that not only reasonable network management but even certain kinds of prioritization were fully lawful in the U.S. under the now wrongly discarded rules we had.

https://www.freepress.net/sites/default/files/2018-04/Free%20Press%20Written%20Testimony%20-%20April%2017%202018%20-%20as%20submitted.pdf Sign in to like this comment Sign in to reply to this comment 4w Report this comment It's simple, if you do not offer what you charge for, refund.
The illusion of "I've paid for it, thus I'm entitled to it" is strong in this one.
I've had few clever customers already figure out that by not appearing to be from Europe, they get full fidelity.
Meaning we just consume more precious resources as we take a VPN connection from Europe to US, and then watch...
It's a true first world problem, but just as entertainment overall, geographical fixes work just as well as geographical blocks on content.
They don't, if people want to consume it, they'll find a way - and if you make it truly hard, they'll find an illegal way.
